column4: From what I've read on the internet, the "advanced" features of my laptop's touchpad should Just Work, but none of them are enabled? What gives?
you need to add the synaptic driver
Okay, cool. That sounds pretty simple.
apt-get install synaptic-driver, or such?
should already be installed
ls /usr/share/doc/xfree86-driver-synaptics
I'll check.
i hope that path is correct, i am using hoary, and there its: ls /usr/share/doc/xorg-driver-synaptics
Yes, I'm also using hoary.
The laptop support is so much more developed.
Yes, I have it.
Which is not a great sign...
yeah, and powermanagement is great
I had a nightmare of a time getting that set up.
Okay, so I have it installed. Maybe my xorg.conf is wrong?
you need to paste some codesnippet into your xorg.conf.
Would that be in the readme?
Stupid question, I can probably figure out myself.
Is there a better idiom than "gunzip -c <file>.gz | less"
vi file
haha
